column4: I have an Asus A7N8X Deluxe nForce2 chipset (Realtek integrated audio)...  I cannot get any audio working.  Anybody have any suggestions?
i guess i did ask for suggestions... =/
i thought the point of linux was open source, free, and anti M$
Yeh, but my recommendation didn't involve windows
so, other than your primary recommendation, do you have any others that involve changing my system config?
None at this stage; like I said: I haven't ever had speakers plugged into my nforce2 system (it's servering and runs with only power & ethernet)
yeah, that is how my server has been as well.  Just trying to convert the main system, and it is rough so far
And as it turns out, it looks like the nforce2 system does NOT have a realtek audio chip.
What does yours say about 'lspci | grep audio' ?
0000:00:05.0 Multimedia audio controller: nVidia Corporation nForce MultiMedia audio [Via VT82C686B]  (rev a2)
Mine's " nVidia Corporation MCP2S AC'97 Audio Controller (rev a1)" and that uses the 'snd-intel8x0' driver. No realtek
yeah, manual specifications: Realtek ALC650 6CH with built-in HP amplifier integrated APU (Deluxe model only) SoundStorm / Dolby Digital (AC-3) Encoder (Deluxe Model Only)
Must be marginally different from mine then.
